value.title: Implement a Windows Server hybrid cloud infrastructure
value.excerpt: You will learn how to address problems relating to the migration of on-premises workloads into Azure. After completing the learning path, you will be able to implement a hybrid Azure infrastructure.

topItems.title: Implement hybrid network infrastructure
topItems.excerpt: You'll learn to connect your on-premises environment to Azure, implement subnets and routing between your on-premises and cloud environments, and ensure that workloads in the cloud and on-premises perform DNS resolution to locate each other.

topItems.title: Implement hybrid identity with Windows Server
topItems.excerpt: Implement hybrid identity with Windows Server

topItems.title: Migrate on-premises Windows Server instances to Azure IaaS virtual machines
topItems.excerpt: You'll be able to plan a migration and select appropriate server migration tools. You will also learn how to use Azure Migrate, how to assess physical servers, and how to migrate those servers.

topItems.title: Implement a hybrid file server infrastructure
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you’ll learn to deploy Azure File Sync, migrate from DFS, and use Storage Migration Services to migrate file servers to Azure.

value.title: Implement Microsoft identity – Associate
value.excerpt: The Microsoft identity platform is an evolution of the Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) developer platform. It allows developers to build applications that sign in users, and access resources in both external applications such as Microsoft Office 365, the Azure portal, and thousands of other SaaS applications and internal resources, such as apps on your corporate network and intranet, along with any cloud apps developed by your own organization. Learn how to utilize Microsoft identity in your custom applications.

topItems.title: Getting Started with Microsoft Identity
topItems.excerpt: Learn the basics of Microsoft identity including the different types of tokens, account types, and supported topologies.

topItems.title: Application types in Microsoft identity
topItems.excerpt: Learn how developers can leverage Microsoft identity in different types of applications.

topItems.title: Permissions and Consent Framework
topItems.excerpt: Learn the basics of Microsoft identity including the different types of tokens, account types, and supported topologies.

topItems.title: Secure custom APIs with Microsoft Identity
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to secure a web API with Microsoft identity and how to call it from another application.

value.title: Implement Windows Server IaaS VM Identity
value.excerpt: After completing this learning path, you’ll know how to implement identity in Azure. You’ll be able to extend an existing on-premises Active Directory identity service into Azure.

topItems.title: Implement hybrid identity with Windows Server
topItems.excerpt: Implement hybrid identity with Windows Server

topItems.title: Deploy and manage Azure IaaS Active Directory domain controllers in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Deploy and manage Azure IaaS active directory domain controllers in Azure

value.title: Implement hybrid identity with Windows Server
value.excerpt: Implement hybrid identity with Windows Server

value.title: Secure Cognitive Services
value.excerpt: Learn how to secure Cognitive Services to prevent data loss and privacy violations for user data that may be a part of the solution.

value.title: Deploy and manage Azure IaaS Active Directory domain controllers in Azure
value.excerpt: Deploy and manage Azure IaaS active directory domain controllers in Azure

value.title: Describe the identity and access management capabilities of Microsoft 365
value.excerpt: Describe the identity and access management capabilities of Microsoft 365

value.title: Enable secure external collaboration for your applications with Azure AD B2B
value.excerpt: Azure AD B2B collaboration lets you securely share your company's applications and services with guest users from any other organization, while maintaining control over your own corporate data.

value.title: Enable secure access to apps for external users with Azure AD B2C
value.excerpt: Use Azure AD B2C as the full-featured identity system for your application, and ensure that users are required to sign in securely by using multi-factor authentication.

value.title: Secure custom APIs with Microsoft Identity
value.excerpt: Learn how to secure a web API with Microsoft identity and how to call it from another application.

value.title: Work with users, groups, and roles in custom apps and APIs
value.excerpt: In this module, you’ll learn how to use both Azure AD Groups and Application Roles to provide fine grained access control to an application.

value.title: Permissions and Consent Framework
value.excerpt: Learn the basics of Microsoft identity including the different types of tokens, account types, and supported topologies.

value.title: Protect your identities with Azure AD Identity Protection
value.excerpt: Use the advanced detection and remediation of identity-based threats to protect your Azure Active Directory identities and applications from compromise.

value.title: Application types in Microsoft identity
value.excerpt: Learn how developers can leverage Microsoft identity in different types of applications.

value.title: Monitor and report on security events in Azure AD
value.excerpt: Keep tabs on security events in your Azure AD resources by using built-in reporting and monitoring capabilities. Respond to events as they happen, and address security risks before they become a problem.

value.title: Getting Started with Microsoft Identity
value.excerpt: Learn the basics of Microsoft identity including the different types of tokens, account types, and supported topologies.

value.title: Build great solutions with the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework
value.excerpt: Learn how to design and build secure, scalable, high-performing solutions in Azure using the pillars of the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework.

topItems.title: Introduction to the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework
topItems.excerpt: Learn how using key principles throughout your cloud architecture can help you design and build a solid architectural foundation that you can continuously improve.

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Cost optimization
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use the cost optimization pillar of the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework to design a cloud-based architecture that is efficient, eliminates waste, and gives you full visibility into where your money is spent on cloud resources.

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Operational excellence
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to design an Azure architecture that uses modern practices and gives you full visibility into what's happening in your environment.

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Performance efficiency
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to adjust your capacity based on workload and how to optimize network performance, storage, and database performance.

value.title: Manage device identity with Azure AD join and Enterprise State Roaming
value.excerpt: Learn how to manage device identity by using Azure AD join and Enterprise State Roaming.

value.title: Add custom domain name to Azure Active Directory
value.excerpt: Learn how to add custom domain name to Azure Active Directory.

value.title: Manage security operations in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to configure security policies and manage security alerts with the tools and services in Azure.

topItems.title: Security, responsibility, and trust in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Discuss the basic concepts for protecting your infrastructure and data when you work in the cloud. Understand what responsibilities are yours and what Azure takes care of for you.

topItems.title: Identify security threats with Azure Security Center
topItems.excerpt: Master securing your Azure workloads with Azure Security Center. In this module, you’ll discover how to detect and respond to threats with Azure Security Center.

topItems.title: Resolve security threats with Azure Security Center
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you’ll use the alert capabilities of Azure Security Center to watch for and respond to threats.

value.title: Allow users to reset their password with Azure Active Directory self-service password reset
value.excerpt: Learn how to allow users to reset their password with Azure Active Directory self-service password reset.

value.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Security
value.excerpt: Discover the tools that Azure provides to help you design a secure environment throughout your infrastructure, data, network, and applications.

value.title: Create Azure users and groups in Azure Active Directory
value.excerpt: Learn how to create Azure users and groups in Azure Active Directory.

value.title: Secure your identities by using Azure Active Directory
value.excerpt: Use Azure Active Directory to you secure your internal, external, and customer identities.

value.title: Security, responsibility, and trust in Azure
value.excerpt: Discuss the basic concepts for protecting your infrastructure and data when you work in the cloud. Understand what responsibilities are yours and what Azure takes care of for you.

value.title: Enable identity protection in Azure Active Directory
value.excerpt: Learn about Azure Active Directory (AD) Identity Protection and ways to optimize the end-user experience while benefiting security.

value.title: Define identity and access management in Azure Active Directory
value.excerpt: Learn about identity and access management in Azure Active Directory and why identity is a core component of your organization’s security posture.

value.title: Manage access to an Azure subscription by using Azure role-based access control (RBAC)
value.excerpt: Learn how to assign management access to a subscription by using Azure role-based access control.

value.title: Manage users and groups in Azure Active Directory
value.excerpt: Manage users and groups in Azure Active Directory

value.title: Secure Azure Active Directory users with Multi-Factor Authentication
value.excerpt: Learn how to use multi-factor authentication with Azure AD to harden your user accounts.
